definitions.definition: To beat or press into pulp or a flat mass; to crush .
To compress or restrict (oneself) into a small space; to squeeze .
examples: Somehow, she squashed all her books into her backpack, which was now too heavy to carry.
We all managed to squash into Mum's tiny car.

definitions.definition: To suppress ; to force into submission .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To beat or press into pulp or a flat mass; to crush .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive ) To compress or restrict (oneself) into a small space; to squeeze .
( transitive ) To suppress ; to force into submission .
